title.narrative: SunCooler: Off Grid Cool Storage for Uganda

description.narrative: Firmtec B.V. develops, advises and builds innovative technical installations for the agricultural sector. Several of their customers in Asia and Africa indicated that they needed a large-scale, simple and robust solar-powered cooling unit. Firmtec recently developed the SunCooler. This is a mobile cooling unit which is suitable for cooling food without being dependent on the electricity network (off grid) or diesel-wasting generators. Solar panels provide the required power to run the cooling system. The SunCooler enables farmers to cool their food supplies close to home (longer shelf life) at lower costs and with a lower environmental impact. And it offers the opportunity to sell their products at times when prices are more interesting. The Suncooler also provides a solution for cooperatives of smallholders that have difficulties entering the electricity network. The focus of this demonstration project is on this target group. The project wants to prove the benefits of this technology for the cooperating farmers and it wants to demonstrate the financial feasibility of investment. The SunCooler has been extensively tested during a pilot project in Kenya. In Uganda the SunCooler technology is unknown yet. The demonstration project will be carried out at the Ugandan company Mish Farm Ltd. Farmers in Poultry and Hot culture. It is a large company where besides chicken also different vegetables are grown. In 2016, the owner received the Best Woman Farmer prize.
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services - Dutch companies
